info.author: Alexander Jaeger
info.description:
# smospy

[![N|Solid](https://cldup.com/dTxpPi9lDf.thumb.png)](https://nodesource.com/products/nsolid)

[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/joemccann/dillinger.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/joemccann/dillinger)

Smospy is a Python package for strong motion seismic data processing.

### Dependencies

smospy uses a number of open source projects to work properly:

* [NumPy](https://aip.scitation.org/doi/abs/10.1109/MCSE.2011.37) - DOI:10.1109/MCSE.2011.37 
* [Matplotlib](https://aip.scitation.org/doi/abs/10.1109/MCSE.2007.55) - DOI:10.1109/MCSE.2007.55 
* [Cython](https://aip.scitation.org/doi/abs/10.1109/MCSE.2010.118) -  DOI:10.1109/MCSE.2010.118 
* [pandas](http://conference.scipy.org/proceedings/scipy2010/mckinney.html)
* [gdal](https://gdal.org)
* [pyshp](https://pypi.org/project/pyshp/)
* [h5py](http://www.h5py.org/)
* [Armadillo](http://arma.sourceforge.net/)

### Installation
The package is available over the [pip](https://pypi.org/) package manager

```sh
$ pip install smospy
```
read the docs [here](http://alejaege.gitext.gfz-potsdam.de/smospydoc/)

info.html_description:
smospy

Smospy is a Python package for strong motion seismic data processing.

Dependencies

smospy uses a number of open source projects to work properly:

  • NumPy - DOI:10.1109/MCSE.2011.37
  • Matplotlib - DOI:10.1109/MCSE.2007.55
  • Cython - DOI:10.1109/MCSE.2010.118
  • pandas
  • gdal
  • pyshp
  • h5py
  • Armadillo

Installation

The package is available over the pip package manager

$ pip install smospy

read the docs here
